intro: Elleanthus teotepecensis, commonly known as the Teotepecan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in the southern regions of Mexico. It produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seeds, typical of the genus. Elleanthus teotepecensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
